applicant_types: Registered charities; Community groups; Not-for-profit organisations; CICs (with restrictions)
geographic_scope: Cheshire East, Cheshire West, Warrington (including Crewe, Knutsford, Neston, Warrington, ForCheshireWest)
beneficiary_focus: Marginalised communities; Low-income families; People experiencing food poverty; People with poor mental health; People with disabilities; Young people; Vulnerable people; Local residents in Cheshire and Warrington
funding_range: Up to £2,500 (Radius Grants); other small grants available, typically up to a few thousand pounds
restrictions: Work which benefits people who live outside of Cheshire East, Cheshire West and Cheshire Warrington is not eligible; Applicants must be based within the funded area (e.g., Crewe for Radius Grants); Annual turnover cap for some programmes (e.g., under £250,000 for Radius Grants); No funding for individuals, for-profit organisations, or projects outside the defined geographic area
application_status: open (for some programmes, e.g., Radius Grants from 29 September 2025 to 2 November 2025); others rolling or seasonal
deadline: 2 November 2025 (Radius Grants); varies for other programmes
notes: Applicants must provide governance documents, recent accounts, safeguarding policy, and meet due diligence requirements. All funded work must directly benefit people in Cheshire East, Cheshire West, or Warrington. No evidence of funding for projects outside these areas.
evidence: 1. The Foundation's explicit restriction is that it only funds work benefiting people who live within Cheshire East, Cheshire West, and Warrington. ('Work which benefits people who live outside of Cheshire East, Cheshire West and Ches... [truncated] ...we won’t be able to give you a grant.') 2. ellenor Hospice is based in Kent and serves Dartford, Gravesham, Swanley, and Bexley, which are not within the eligible geographic area. 3. All grant programmes, including the Radius Grants and Small Grants, require delivery within the Cheshire/Warrington area. 4. No evidence of exceptions or UK-wide funding. 5. Therefore, ellenor Hospice is not eligible for any funding from Cheshire Community Foundation.
